content: How are folks feeling about progress on 1.18. I'm going to try and spend more time in the core issue queue this month. We have feature freeze in 4 weeks.

Maybe not really affected by a feature freeze (is a bugfix), but one issue really needs some testers:

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/3792

Unfortunately this issue blocks yet another bugfix issue.

@StPaulTim maybe you could test the new step validation approach, especially regarding decimals. No complicated math, just create a decimal field and try to input different values.

Simple decimals fail to pass validation · Issue #3792 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the bug I am running into a problem where a number/decimal field is not allowing values that should pass the validation. It is possibly related to this Drupal 8 issue? Not certain bu...
Started working on context relationships this weekend. To sow more confusion. :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:.

...context relationships... sow more confusion

Success - I'm confused. :big_smile: What are context relationships and ... ehm ... in which context are you planning to add them. Layouts?

:grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2134

Add support for "Relationships" to Layout Contexts · Issue #2134 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
In many situations when working with Layouts you want or need information related to the primary thing being displayed. For example if you had created a layout configuration for the path node/%, yo...
This is a logical progression from the issue for custom contexts, which some of us never quite understood after multiple explanations.
I expect this one to be even more opaque
Would that also allow for reference module to dynamically allow contexts based on reference fields?

Hey guys :wave: ...sorry I've missed the past 2-3 dev meetings, but I'm looking to update https://backdropcms.org/roadmap and noticed that some of the "usual gang members" are not officially listed as advocates for any feature for 1.18.0. It is my understanding that besides those listed in the dev agenda, the following people are advocating for the respective issues; please correct me if wrong:

  • @docwilmot https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2134
  • @jenlampton ???
  • @klonos https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2714
    ...any others?
Add support for "Relationships" to Layout Contexts · Issue #2134 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
In many situations when working with Layouts you want or need information related to the primary thing being displayed. For example if you had created a layout configuration for the path node/%, yo...
[UX] Merge all the "Update core/module/theme/layout" pages into a single page. · Issue #2714 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Describe your issue or idea Currently, in the "Available Updates report" page, the site admin can see which projects have updates, but the actions they can do are limited to a) downloadin...
Doesn't @jenlampton have like 20 issues she's advocating?
...same can be said for me though :sweat_smile: ...we need to pick one at a time, drive it to finish, then pick another.
Anyone can advocate for as many issues as they like, but one can only be an Advocate for one at a time. ;-)
In general yes, but my 1.18 issue is happening in contrib (and, not very quickly) so I don't really have one this time.
Can I go ahead and advocate for the .htaccess Brotli fix? 1.18 seems like a good candidate for this small fix.
The question is, who can I talk into doing the PR for it because I have no idea how to do that.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4748

Disable Brotli for pre-compressed CSS and JS · Issue #4748 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need When Brotli is in use on a web server that serves pages through https and "aggregate css and(or) aggregate js" are enabled, the CSS and JS files do not "decod...

Hey @docwilmot :wave: ...it seems that you have been advocating for https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/2134 to get in for 1.18.0, but you have not explicitly added yourself as the advocate, so we cannot add the 1.18.0 milestone to the issue. If you ley me know, that you are indeed advocating, I can do all that for you :wink:

Add support for "Relationships" to Layout Contexts · Issue #2134 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
In many situations when working with Layouts you want or need information related to the primary thing being displayed. For example if you had created a layout configuration for the path node/%, yo...
...and I can then add it to https://backdropcms.org/roadmap too

@jenlampton I made a suggestion for you here re. the PHP Weekly newsletter: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4876#issuecomment-760603002

Backdrop 1.18.0 Release checklist · Issue #4876 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Scheduled for January 15, 2021 10am - 4pm PT Pre-release tasks Merge minor release commits @quicksketch Draft Release notes @jenlampton Copy Preview release release notes, update as follows Include...

I was considering making a new (birthday celebration) Gource video showing Backdrop's development over the past 12 months. Then I realised the last 12 months of Backdrop development has been during 'covid'. Now I'm wondering if Gource has an option to make the little animated characters social-distance from each other... :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes:
@quicksketch is it time?
not time yet...
I don't know about Gource.

So, as assigned, I'm trying to write a blog post. The biggest thing I need is the list of what features the release contains. So far, I have this (from https://backdropcms.org/roadmap)

  1. Support for WebP image format (if the installed PHP version supports it)
  2. Menu blocks: allow defining custom breakpoints
  3. Advanced Caching (a.k.a. cache tags and cache max-age)
  4. Media library dialog: allow filtering by filename
  5. Upgrade UI module (similar to Migrate UI in D8) to help with moving from D7

Which of those made it? What else is in it?

(I've been looking through Github, but it's not clear to me which items are identifiable features that are part of this release)
Let's see if I can be of anny help.
I don't know if changing full_html to raw_html is worth highlighting.

I think this is probably your best source of info:
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.18.0-preview

Release 1.18.0-preview · backdrop/backdrop
This is the preview release of the next version of Backdrop. The official 1.18.0 version will be released January 15, 2021. Please use this version to test new features and ensure compatibility bef...
Lots of changes in this version, but not many that are headliners.
@StPaulTim Did you see this one I made 6 years ago? YouTube - YouTube

@Luke McCormick (cellear) - take a look at closed issues on the milestone.
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/milestone/93?closed=1

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.
@BWPanda - No, I never saw that before. Cool!
Hi folks! There are few more RTBC issues I want to get in and then we'll start the release process!
@BWPanda that is so cool!!! (How have I never seen this before?!?!)
@jenlampton No idea. Guess I'm just a better developer than I am a marketer :wink:

I moved all 1.17.5 issues to 1.18.1 and closed the 1.17.5 milestone. Release notes are generating! https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/actions

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.

@jenlampton Could you grab the release notes from the bottom of https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/actions/runs/489244381 (under "Artifacts") and edit as needed?

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.

BWPanda said:

jenlampton No idea. Guess I'm just a better developer than I am a marketer :wink:

Touché

quicksketch said:

jenlampton Could you grab the release notes from the bottom of [link] (under "Artifacts") and edit as needed?

yep!

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.17.5 is cut :smile: Now for the main event!

Release 1.17.5 · backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop 1.17.5

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.18.0 is now cut as well!

Release 1.18.0 · backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop 1.18.0
Can I get a sanity-check on these release notes?

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4877

Backdrop 1.17.5 Release checklist · Issue #4877 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Release scheduled for January 15th, 2021 10am - 4pm PT Pre-release tasks Merge commits @quicksketch Create the next bugfix milestone @jenlampton Move all unfinished issues to the next bugfix releas...
Looks good to me, but then I don't really know what I'm looking for... :smiling_face:

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.17.5 is out

Release 1.17.5 · backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop 1.17.5
Looking for anything obviously wrong is really all I need. Like forgetting to mention .htacces was changed would have been bad...

Hmmm, wonder if there's a way we can set a label or something in an issue when we know it changes .htaccess, which then marks the milestone as such... So then you don't have to know what each issue does in order to determine what major changes were made for that release.
@BWPanda this release notes thing is amazing...
that would be great! there are only 3 files we need to track for those changes, so sounds reasonable.
suggestions for label name?
Thanks. I didn't really fully appreciate how helpful it was until now. I thought it only worked for minor releases (e.g. 1.18.0) but now I see it works for bug-fix releases too (e.g. 1.17.5).
or, I wonder if we even need a label. Could we automate that chegk?

It seems you can't add labels to milestones themselves (which is what I was thinking), but I guess adding a label to individual issues will still make it easier to scan a milestone for those changes... I'll look into options for automating adding a label to an issue if its PR changes any of those 3 files...
I wish we had a tool other than labels. We have so many labels...
The release notes generator uses the issues list exclusively. It doesn't check the Git code, tags, or branches at all.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/releases/tag/1.18.0 is out!

Release 1.18.0 · backdrop/backdrop
Backdrop 1.18.0
I meant I wish github gave us more tools for the issues list. Even 4 different sets of tags would be great.
@StPaulTim are you available to do the tweeting?
sounds like no... should I tweet?
@Luke McCormick (cellear) any luck with the blog post?
They're all off partying already :smiley:
fair :)

I've updated the API site, but got sidetracked... @BWPanda do you remember why we used node_reference instead of reference? https://github.com/backdrop-ops/api.backdropcms.org/issues/112

Replace node reference module with reference module · Issue #112 · backdrop-ops/api.backdropcms.org
Since reference will eventually be in core, we should be using that on our own sites. If there is a limitation in reference that makes references preferable, we should fix that. :) This is a placeh...
API site updated to 1.18.0
@jenlampton Not 100% sure, but I suspect I didn't think Reference was stable enough to be used on a production site. Either that or maybe I initially tried it but encounted bugs...
I know I have tried Reference before (and had issues with it), but can't remember whether that was on the API site or one of my own...
I was thinking it might have been missing a feature we needed.
I'm using reference on a handful of production sites, but wth a ton of patches.
I just got maintainer access for that project though, so the more we can find/fix the better :)
API site only has one field that references a node: https://api.backdropcms.org/admin/reports/fields So I'm guessing that's pretty basic functionality
That's what I was thinking, but wasn't brave enough to swap it out since I don't really understand how all the fapi relationships work
@jenlampton Out of curiosity, why does the API site get updated with the Preview release, but other sites get updated with official release (two weeks later)?

That's what I was thinking, but wasn't brave enough to swap it out since I don't really understand how all the fapi relationships work

@jenlampton You're welcome to make a PR that just swaps it out, then we can see if it breaks anything in the Tugboat sandbox.

BWPanda said:

jenlampton Out of curiosity, why does the API site get updated with the Preview release, but other sites get updated with official release (two weeks later)?

because the API site is the least risk. It's mostly anonymous traffic

BWPanda said:

That's what I was thinking, but wasn't brave enough to swap it out since I don't really understand how all the fapi relationships work

jenlampton You're welcome to make a PR that just swaps it out, then we can see if it breaks anything in the Tugboat sandbox.

yes! tugboat :heart:

@StPaulTim I tweeted, but feel free to retweet (everyone, actually!) https://twitter.com/backdropcms/status/1350278957250199554

We're thrilled to announce Backdrop version 1.18.0. This is the 19th new feature release of #BackdropCMS. https://backdropcms.org Thanks, as always, to the fabulous Backdrop community for all the fantastic new features!

- Backdrop CMS (@backdropcms)
Sorry, I wasn't able to help more because I was busy making my Backdrop cookies.
IMG_20210115_211510361.jpg
The snowdev was hungry.

Umm, well..I'm working on it?

https://backdropcms.org/news/backdrop-118-released

Was my deadline today?
@Luke McCormick (cellear) - As the author of a couple of previous release blog posts, I can assure you that they don't always go out on release day.
I think that the sooner the better, but anytime in the next couple of days would be acceptable (in my opinion).
I added a few screenshots and a little verbage to help move this forward.
Thanks, they’re very helpful.

Is 1.18.0 a security release?
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4880

Backdrop 1.18 shows as "security update" · Issue #4880 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Not sure if this is a bug, so I start it as a question. On sites that had 1.18.0-preview installed (for testing), 1.18.0 shows as "security update". The "Available update" page ...
Whoops just realized I saw that on a testing site that was on 1.17.3 (hadn't been upgraded to 1.17.4 as I thought)... :flushed:

jenlampton said:

I'm using reference on a handful of production sites, but wth a ton of patches.

That's a selling point.

Thank you all contributors for the 1.18 release:-) I did not follow the Zulip channel that much lately, because I was busy creating Backdrop sites, plus writing a longer article for a german web magazine about Backdrop CMS (February issue). Looking forward to try 1.18:-)
@mazze.ch ++
mazze.ch (Karma: 12)

I’ve finished the blog post announcing the release of 1.18. Can I ask people to take a look and let me know where I’ve gone horribly wrong? I had to do some spelunking around the issue queues to understand what a lot of things were, and I’m not at all sure I understood the significance of everything.

https://backdropcms.org/news/backdrop-1-18-released
Thanks @cellear (Luke McCormick) ...I'm having a :eyes:
...seems that we can lose the "Today ..." which the article begins with, since it's already the 18th.
It was when I wrote that!
I like the blog post, thank you @cellear (Luke McCormick)
Yeah @cellear (Luke McCormick) ++
mccormick)** Props to you for all your hard work. (Karma: 1)
Excellent blog post, @cellear (Luke McCormick)!
Thank you very much, @cellear (Luke McCormick) ! Wonderful and welcoming introduction to the release!
I thought I just wish it was published on 15th. Wonderful anyway!
@jenlampton @StPaulTim The newsletter's ready-to-go. Friday is officially two weeks since the release, so do you want me to send it then, or is another day better?

As long as we get 1.8.1 out to Pantheon etc on Weds, It can go immediately
after that. Friday should be fine as I wouldn't expect another release
until the next Wednesday.
I created a PR for the Pantheon repo last week but can wait until we've got 1.18.1 @jenlampton

This release might seem a bit "slim", since many of the features we've been planning needed more work and had to be moved to 1.19.0, but I must say, I'm really impressed by the rate our community has been fixing bugs and addressing many other issues over the past few months :heart:

BWPanda said:

jenlampton StPaulTim The newsletter's ready-to-go. Friday is officially two weeks since the release, so do you want me to send it then, or is another day better?

I've got another blog post scheduled to publish on Friday that should probably take the place of the current one in the newsletter. It's the one about contrib permissions increases.

I wasn't necessarily adding the latest content to the newsletter, but the recent ones I thought best to bring attention to. So I think the blog article can stay, then we can see what articles we have to pick from for the next newsletter. I think monthly is a good timeframe for newsletters, if possible.
